meanings.definition: The shafts or poles of a vehicle to which the harness is attached.
meanings.sent1: The horse pulled the carriage with ease as it was attached to the thills.
meanings.sent2: The farmer secured the harness to the thills before setting off on the wagon.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat tried to climb onto the thills of the parked cart.
meanings.sent4: The thills of the wagon cut through the fog like a sharp knife.
meanings.sent5: The wooden thills creaked softly as the carriage rolled along the path.

meanings.sent3: The children playfully tried to thills the dog to their toy wagon.
meanings.sent4: His determination to thills the wild stallion to the carriage paid off.
